meanings.definition: To bring under the control of one's own country.
meanings.sent1: The government decided to patriate the disputed territory.
meanings.sent2: The king patriates the neighboring lands to expand his kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The flag patriates the new island as part of the nation.
meanings.sent4: The treaty patriates the small province into the larger empire.
meanings.sent5: The general's strategy is to patriate the rebel-held regions back into the kingdom.

meanings.definition: A person who has been granted citizenship in a country.
meanings.sent1: The patriot is a loyal citizen who loves their country.
meanings.sent2: Many patriates celebrate their national holidays with pride.
meanings.sent3: The young patriate proudly sings the national anthem at the event.
meanings.sent4: The patriate's family roots are deeply connected to this land.
meanings.sent5: The community warmly welcomes the new patriate with open arms.
